hints.content:
There are $\greenD{20}$ people with $\purpleC2$ people in each group.

![Same image with the people in a row numbered 1 through 2 and horizontal lines between the rows](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1604e6de4b55503929e7aea4ae550c832609a925)

How can we find out how many groups of people there are?

We can find how many groups of people there are by dividing:

$\greenD{\text{total}}\div\purpleC{\text{ size of the rows}}$

So, $\greenD{20}\div\purpleC{2}$

The following expression will tell us how many groups of people there are:

- $\greenD{20}\div\purpleC2$

question.content:
There are $20$ total people split into groups of $2$. 

![20 people with 2 people per row](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/9e70f55dd8fd93293cdaeaed89b3add9207856f6) 

**Which expression will tell us how many groups of people there are?**
